title: Turkey's Erdogan trails behind oppone nt ahead of election
description: Polls are showing Turkey's leader of more than two decades, Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, is trailing behind opposing leader Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu just as voters head to the polls in a high-stakes election. NBC's Matt Bradley reports.

title: Israeli airstrike destroys house in Beit Lahiya, Gaza
description: The owner, Ahmad Taha, denied Israeli claims the building was being used by Palestinian militants. “After the noon prayer, they called me and asked me to leave the house and alert the neighbors,” he said.

title: Mexico to launch database tool of over 10,000 missing people
description: Mexico will launch a new tool later this month to help record information on the tens of thousands of people who have gone missing.

title: ‘Fundamentally unacceptable’: U.S. envoy accuses South Africa of arming Russia
description: “We are confident that weapons were loaded onto that vessel and I would bet my life on the accuracy of that assertion,” said U.S. ambassador Reuben Brigety.

title: Migrants in the treacherous Darien jungle find a more organized route
description: Migrants in the treacherous Darien jungle on the Colombia-Panama border find an increasingly organized route and most didn't know about U.S. immigration changes.

title: Imran Khan granted bail, leaves high court amid tight security
description: Violent protests broke out across Pakistan after the former prime minister was seized by paramilitary troops while appearing in court earlier in the week.

title: Handful of LGBTQ candidates square off with President Erdogan ahead of key Turkish election
description: A handful of LGBTQ candidates are squaring off against Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan ahead of elections on Sunday.

title: Ex-NBA star Dwight Howard sparks anger in China by calling Taiwan a 'country'
description: HONG KONG — Former NBA star Dwight Howard faced a wave of fury in China on Friday after referring to Taiwan as a “country” in a promotional video.

title: Swiss village evacuated over fears it's about to be wiped out in a massive rockslide
description: Residents of the Swiss village of Brienz have been forced to evacuate after officials said a chunk of the Lenzerhorn mountain could be about to collapse into a rockfall or landslide.

title: Watch: French surgeon sings to relax patients before surgery
description: Gynecologist and obstetrician Dr. Aïcha N'Doye uses her amazing singing voice to relax patients at the Polyclinique Bordeaux Nord in southern France.

title: Drone video shows attack on Russian troops in Bakhmut, Ukraine's military says
description: Drone video that appears to show Russian soldiers being attacked in the eastern city of Bakhmut has been released by a Ukrainian army brigade.

title: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan released on bail
description: A high court in Islamabad has granted former Prime Minister Imran Khan a two-week reprieve from arrest in a graft case and granted him bail on the charges.

title: Russian woman given a suspended sentence for a note she left at the president's parents' grave
description: A court in St. Petersburg delivered a two-year suspended sentence to Irina Tsybaneva, 60, for a note she left on Vladimir Putin's parents' grave.

title: U.S. envoy says Russian ship picked up weapons in South Africa
description: The United States envoy to South Africa said on Thursday he was confident that a Russian ship had picked up weapons in South Africa last year, in a possible breach of Pretoria’s declared neutrality in the Ukraine conflict.

title: Woman convicted after leaving note on Putin's parents' grave saying they 'raised a freak and a killer'
description: A Russian court gave a two-year suspended sentence Thursday to a St. Petersburg woman who left a note on the grave of President Vladimir Putin’s parents that said they had “raised a freak and a killer."

title: Sudan's rival forces agree to protect civilians but no cease-fire
description: Sudan’s warring factions early on Friday committed to protect civilians and the movement of humanitarian aid, but did not agree to a cease-fire and remain far apart, U.S. officials said.

title: Israeli airstrikes on Gaza continue even as hopes for a cease-fire grow
description: Israeli airstrikes against Palestinian militant targets in the Gaza Strip continued for a third day Friday.

title: Residents ordered to leave Swiss village over rockslide fears
description: Swiss authorities have ordered residents to abandon the tiny village of Brienz because of fears it will soon be buried beneath a collapsing mountainside.
